73 years ago there was only one country
called Korea it had one homogeneous
population of thirty million people it
had happy families living across the
land and freedom to roam north or south
but that all changed on June 25th 1950
when soldiers from the Soviet backed
communist North bombarded across the
38th parallel into the western-backed
Republic south a long bloody war led to
Korea being split up with a thick border
on the DMZ families were split up
lifestyles were changed opportunities
were destroyed and today the two Koreas
remain about his opposite as any two
countries on the planet it's capitalism
birth communism the land of
possibilities verse the land of
uncertainties I find it very upsetting
to think about what has happened to this
lovely country and the division that
remains among its people and then April
27th 2018 Kim jong-un becomes the first
North Korean leader to step foot south
of his border since 1953 he met with
South Korea's president moon jaein
shared a few laughs and they signed a
denuclearization agreement even more
surprising Kim jong-un is planning to
meet with Trump later this month I'm not
sure what all of this means nor what it
will lead to but I am hopeful that it is
a step in the right direction towards
peace and reunification
if North and South Korea were unified
alas then trade would open up families
could get back together businesses would
boom missiles will be taken away tens of
thousands of US troops will be sent home
and most importantly the Korean people
can live in peace like they once did 73
years ago the future for Korea is still
too soon to know if there will be a
radical transformation but we can only
hope for the best
now I'm gonna ask you what are your
